text: The following is a summary of Down county football team's 2020 season, which is in its 117th year. The season was suspended in March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The season resumed in mid-October of the same year. == Kits == {| class="wikitable" | | |} == Competitions == == Dr McKenna Cup == The draw for the 2020 Dr McKenna Cup was made on 4 December 2019. ===Fixtures=== {| class="wikitable" |- | Date || Round || Home || Score || Away || Ground || Ref |- bgcolor="#7eff7e" | 29 December 2019 || Group || Fermanagh || 0-07 v 1-11 || Down || Brewster Park, Enniskillen || |- bgcolor="#7eff7e" | 8 January 2020 || Group || Down || 2-17 v 0-15 || Antrim || Páirc Esler, Newry || |- bgcolor="#fdcbcb" | 12 January 2020 || Semi-final || Tyrone || 2-16 v 1-10 || Down || Athletic Grounds, Armagh || |} ===Table=== === Reports === == National Football League Division 3 == Down will compete in Division Three for the 2020 National League season. Fixtures were published by the GAA on 26 November 2019. On 12 March 2020 the GAA suspended the National League in mid-March due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Games resumed in October 2020. === Fixtures === {| class="wikitable" |Date |Round |Home |Score |Away |Ground |Ref |- style="background:#ffff85;" |Saturday 26 January |Group |Tipperary | 0-10 v 0-10 |Down |Clonmel GAA Ground, Clonmel | |- style="background:#7eff7e;" |Saturday 1 February |Group |Down |0-14 v 0-12 |Derry |Páirc Esler, Newry | |- style="background:#fdcbcb;" |Sunday 9 February |Group |Cork | 0-16 v 1-08 |Down |Páirc Uí Chaoimh, Cork | |- style="background:#7eff7e;" |Saturday 22 February |Group |Down | 2-13 v 1-14 |Longford |Páirc Esler, Newry | |- style="background:#7eff7e;" |Sunday 1 March |Group |Offaly | 0-09 v 0-17 |Down |O'Connor Park, Tullamore | |- style="background:#33FFFF;" |Saturday 14 March |Group |Down |P v P |Leitrim |Páirc Esler, Newry | |- style="background:#33FFFF;" |Sunday 22 March |Group |Louth |P v P |Down |Drogheda Park, Drogheda | |- style="background:#7eff7e;" |Saturday 17 October |Group |Down |C v C |Leitrim |Páirc Esler, Newry | |- style="background:#fff;" |Sunday 25 October |Group |Louth |v |Down |Drogheda Park, Drogheda | |} === Table === Down are ahead of Longford due to the head to head rule.https://twitter.com/OfficialLDGAA/status/1234202841763459074 === Reports === == Ulster Senior Football Championship == The draw for the 2020 Ulster Senior Football Championship took place on 9 October 2019. On 26 November 2019 it was confirmed that Down will face Fermanagh on 24 May 2020. This date was then changed to 8 November due to the COVID-19 pandemic. ===Fixtures=== {| class="wikitable" |- | Date || Round || Team 1 || Score || Team 2 || Ground || Ref |- style="background:#fff;" | 8 November 2020 || Quarter Final || Fermanagh || v || Down || Brewster Park, Enniskillen || |} === Bracket === == 2020 All-Ireland Senior Football Championship == Down's entry into the 2020 All Ireland depends on their Ulster Championship performance and will be announced in due course. == References == Gaelic Down Category:Down county football team seasons
title: 2020 Down county football team season
